title: Zeitlin's model for axisymmetric 3-D Euler equations
authors: Klas Modin and Stephen C. Preston
abstract:
Zeitlin's model is a spatial discretization for the 2-D Euler equations on
the flat 2-torus or the 2-sphere. Contrary to other discretizations, it
preserves the underlying geometric structure, namely that the Euler equations
describe Riemannian geodesics on a Lie group. Here we show how to extend
Zeitlin's approach to the axisymmetric Euler equations on the 3-sphere. It is
the first discretization of the 3-D Euler equations that fully preserves the
geometric structure. Thus, this finite-dimensional model admits Riemannian
curvature and Jacobi equations, which are discussed.
